name: Seaview Holiday Park

reviews.title: a lovely time had by all..
reviews.text: Just returned from Seaview, we stayed in a silver caravan for 3 windy, wet nights. We had a really happy family holiday. The bar staff who doubled up as waiters and waitresses were very helpful and friendly (thanks Sam and Matt..great!). The flexidine package was excellent value for food with a good choice and nicely cooked and presented.

reviews.title: A Disappointing Return
reviews.text: My little 5 year old really enjoyed the kids entertainment in the evening and although he was shy to take part Stuart made an effort to come over to him and encourage him. Stuart and Ritchy who run the entertainment for kids and adults work their socks off and were extremely pleasant , friendly and helpful to the kids and adults.

reviews.title: very simple holiday nice and quiet !
reviews.text: We had a beautiful long , windy walk along the coast to Herne bay and also visited Whitstable which is a fabulously classy and cool little place, harbor street with all it's little unusual shops is lovely as is the fish market area with the little shops in huts.

reviews.title: Great mid weekbreak in October
reviews.text: All in all a great weekend in a great location, we will definitely back.

reviews.title: Brilliant
reviews.text: This year was our third year at Seaview. Last year we had a great time. The caravan was superb and the facilities in the club house were perfect for us including table tennis and darts. The location of the park is excellent with easy access to Herne Bay & Canterbury. This year we decided to upgrade to a Silver caravan with three beds as my wife's sons are 20 & 22 and need their space. Unfortunately the van was a let down. The carpet in the lounge was dirty and worn and due to being a three bed it felt smaller than last years van. On day one the shower broke, it was repaired the same day, but just showed the van was run down. In the club house the facilities have all changed and the only activity we could play as a family is Pool. We understand you can't please everyone, however for the type of break we were on with young adults, the table tennis and darts were a welcome recreation in the evening and as a family gave us an opportunity to have some fun with a couple of beers. As this couldn't happen we certainly spent less on site and instead walked down to the very nice pub (The Plough).

description: The park’s facilities are centred around the main entertainment complex with our new venue now EVEN better for our holiday guests. With so many places to visit, you will probably want to spend most days touring the garden of England. Famous castles, fishing ports, cathedral cities and dramatic coastal scenery are all within a short drive from Seaview.
